definition: history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: Zhou Dynasty's historiographers and Zhouli have a close relationship.
sentences.chinese: 周代史官與周禮之間有着密切的關係。

sentences.english: Historiographers' expertise was the knowledge background of the Yin-Yang school.
sentences.chinese: 史官的王官之學是陰陽五行家的知識背景。

sentences.english: Lastly, the significant feature of Chinese study thoughts is historiographer culture.
sentences.chinese: 史官文化形態是中國學習思想的顯著特徵之一。

sentences.english: "Zuo Zhuan" It was said that the late Spring and Autumn Annals written by historian Zuo Qiuming.
sentences.chinese: 《左傳》相傳是春秋末期的史官左丘明所著。

sentences.english: Chunqiu historiographers' learning were very extensive, they had many self-restraints.
sentences.chinese: 春秋時期的史官學識廣博，具有多方面的修養。

sentences.english: Last, we analyzed the records which some historiographers participate in the fortune-telling movement.
sentences.chinese: 最後，分析了部分史官參與占卜的記載。

sentences.english: Until the Eastern Han Dynasty, historian with the ephemeris officer is always unity.
sentences.chinese: 直到東漢，史官與星曆官始終是合一的。

definition: Grand Scribe, the title by which Sima Qian 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1] refers to himself in Records of the Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4]
grand scribe (official position in many Chinese states up to the Han)
official in charge of public records
Sima Qian (145-86 BC), Han Dynasty historian, author of Records of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4], known as the father of Chinese historiography
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
Ban Gu (32-92), Eastern Han dynasty historian, wrote the Dynastic History of Western Han 漢書|汉书
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
